content.body: looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/15129 — when `setTimeout(handler, timeout, ...arguments)` is called with a _timeout_ that’s not a number, what spec defines how it gets coerced into a number?
content.formatted_body: looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/15129 — when setTimeout(handler, timeout, ...arguments) is called with a timeout that’s not a number, what spec defines how it gets coerced into a number?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/15129 — when `setTimeout(handler, timeout, ...arguments)` is called with a _timeout_ that’s not a number, what spec defines how it gets coerced into a number?

looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/15129 — when setTimeout(handler, timeout, ...arguments) is called with a timeout that’s not a number, what spec defines how it gets coerced into a number?

content.body: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/timers-and-user-prompts.html#timer-initialisation-steps says nothing about coercing _timeout_ to a number but instead assumes it’s already a number
content.formatted_body: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/timers-and-user-prompts.html#timer-initialisation-steps says nothing about coercing timeout to a number but instead assumes it’s already a number

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/timers-and-user-prompts.html#timer-initialisation-steps says nothing about coercing _timeout_ to a number but instead assumes it’s already a number
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/timers-and-user-prompts.html#timer-initialisation-steps says nothing about coercing timeout to a number but instead assumes it’s already a number

content.body: I guess somehow I end up at https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#abstract-opdef-converttoint
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I guess somehow I end up at https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#abstract-opdef-converttoint

content.body: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#windoworworkerglobalscope-mixin says the definition is `long setTimeout(TimerHandler handler, optional long timeout = 0, any... arguments);`
content.formatted_body: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#windoworworkerglobalscope-mixin says the definition is long setTimeout(TimerHandler handler, optional long timeout = 0, any... arguments);

content.body: so, the conversion defined in https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#es-long happens
